org.jlab.coda.emu.support.transport

Interface DataTransport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CODAStateMachine, StatedObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataTransportAdapter, DataTransportImplCmsg, DataTransportImplEmu, DataTransportImplEt, DataTransportImplFifo, DataTransportImplFile

    public interface DataTransport
extends CODAStateMachine, StatedObject
    This interface defines how data is transported and does not refer to a particular data connection.
    Author:
    heyes, timmer Sep 17, 2008

    • Method Summary

      This method gets an attribute as an int.
      java.lang.String getTransportClass()
      This method gets the name of the transport class implementing this interface.
      boolean isConnected()
      This method tells if this DataTransport object is connected.
      boolean isServer()
      This method returns true if this DataTransport object is a server (sends data) or false if it is a client (receives data).

      • createChannel

        DataChannel createChannel(java.lang.String name,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributeMap,
                          boolean isInput,
                          Emu emu,
                          EmuModule module,
                          int outputIndex)
                   throws DataTransportException
        This method creates a DataChannel object.
        Parameters:
        name - name of DataChannel
        attributeMap - hashmap of attributes taken from XML config file
        isInput - true if this channel puts data into the Emu, else false
        emu - Emu owning this channel
        module - module creating this channel
        outputIndex - order in which module's events will be sent to this output channel (0 for first output channel, 1 for next, etc.).
        Returns:
        DataChannel object
        Throws:
        DataTransportException - if transport problem

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        This method tells if this DataTransport object is connected.
        Returns:
        true if this object is connected, else false

      • isServer

        boolean isServer()
        This method returns true if this DataTransport object is a server (sends data) or false if it is a client (receives data).
        Returns:
        true if this DataTransport object sends data, else false

      • getTransportClass

        java.lang.String getTransportClass()
        This method gets the name of the transport class implementing this interface.
        Returns:
        the name of the transport class implementing this interface
